intro: Chiloschista segawae var. taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan chiloschista, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions and forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
